THANK YOU i was about to come over here to rant about minecraft education edition exitsting and mojang not being able to port non education edition to chromebook when i saw this. so firstly i want to thank you for bringing this wonderful game to more people. now time to give some actual feedback. i have a low end $100 hp chromebook(though i may get a new maybe better one i don't know). here are the specific specs

prossesor:

AMD A4-9120C RADEON R4, 5 COMPUTE CORES 2C+3G (2 threads, 1.60GHz)

my chromebook does support 64-bit (x86_64, arm64-v8a)

when i go to download the early access version it says my chromebook is not compatible. if you can optimize the game to where my specs will work i would be thrilled.

I have a Chromebook (don't judge me) and there was once an issue that made me uninstall the app, but when I signed in to my Microsoft¬Æ account, all my progress was deleted. Like Mojang¬Æ, just add a button that downloads the world (or just add a setting that automatically backs up all worlds)! The same way photos in Google Photos, iCloud Photos, Microsoft OneDrive, etc. automatically back up to Google Drive, iCloud, and Microsoft OneDrive is the same way that Minecraft¬Æ should automatically back up the world to Microsoft OneDrive for Microsoft¬Æ's Windows PCs, iCloud for Apple¬Æ's Macs, iCloud for Apple¬Æ's iPhones/iPads, Google Drive for Android phones/tablets, etc.
